body_html:
From the document: "set_shape(shape) Updates the shape of this tensor."
set_shape doesn't really set the shape to something else. It updates the shape, i.e. you cannot set a tensor of shape [10,100] to [10, None].

So I feel it would be even more confusing if assignment statements like tensor.shape = new_shape is allowed. tensor.shape |= new_shape matches the semantics better.
body_text:
From the document: "set_shape(shape) Updates the shape of this tensor."
set_shape doesn't really set the shape to something else. It updates the shape, i.e. you cannot set a tensor of shape [10,100] to [10, None].
So I feel it would be even more confusing if assignment statements like tensor.shape = new_shape is allowed. tensor.shape |= new_shape matches the semantics better.
body:
From the document: "set_shape(shape) Updates the shape of this tensor."
`set_shape` doesn't really set the shape to something else. It updates the shape, i.e. you cannot set a tensor of shape [10,100] to [10, None].

So I feel it would be even more confusing if assignment statements like `tensor.shape = new_shape` is allowed. `tensor.shape |= new_shape` matches the semantics better.
